quotes.quote: Waves are toys from God.
Listen to the sound of waves within you.
Waves are the practice of water. To speak of waves apart from water, or water apart from waves, is a delusion.
Waves are not measured in feet or inches, they are measured in increments of fear.
Let the waves carry you where the light can not.
You can never ride on the wave that came in and went out yesterday.
The boisterous sea of liberty is never without a wave.
A wave is never found alone, but is mingled with the other waves.

There are always waves on the water. Sometimes they are big, sometimes they are small, and sometimes they are almost imperceptible. The water's waves are churned up by the winds, which come and go and vary in direction and intensity, just as do the winds of stress and change in our lives, which stir up the waves in our minds.
Waves are inspiring not because they rise and fail, but because each time they fall. They never fail to rise again.
The breaking of a wave cannot explain the whole sea.
Only those who row the boat make waves.
Waves are not as dangerous as fear of waves.
The wave does not need to die to become water. She is already water.
A wave isn't like a skate ramp or mountain; everything's moving around, and you have to time how to move along with it. That's easier with a slow wave.
Stop running after the waves. Let the sea come to you.
Waves keep coming, that's the one thing you can count on in life.
There is not secret to balance. You just have to feel the waves.
The winds and the waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.
Wild waves rise and fall when they arriveÂ and that's what makes the calm sea alive.
There is no new wave, only the sea.
The wave is the same thing as the water, the effect is the cause in another form.
You can't stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.
The sea is a desert of waves, A wilderness of water.
For a surfer, it's never-ending. There's always some wave you want to surf.
Every wave, regardless of how high and forceful it crests, must eventually collapse within itself.Â
Every wave is new until it breaks.
Waves, once they land on the beach, are not reversible.
You never really know what's coming. A small wave, or maybe a big one. All you can really do is hope that when it comes, you can surf over it, instead of drown in its monstrosity.
There's no way to move without making waves.
